questions.text: Does the organization have a documented AI strategy?
questions.desc: 1 = No, 5 = Yes, with clear goals and alignment.

questions.text: Are AI initiatives aligned with business objectives?
Is there a cross-functional team or AI governance framework in place?
Does the organization have a process to identify and prioritize AI use cases?
questions.desc: 1 = No process, 5 = Well-defined and ongoing process.

questions.text: How effective is the organization at finding new AI use cases across departments?
questions.desc: 1 = Not effective, 5 = Highly effective and systematic.

questions.text: How would you rate the quality of your data for AI use cases?
Are data pipelines and infrastructure in place to support AI workloads?
Are data governance policies in place?
How well does the organization evaluate existing AI tools and platforms before adoption?
questions.desc: 1 = No evaluation, 5 = Rigorous and ongoing evaluation.

questions.text: How does the organization decide what AI solutions to build vs. buy?
questions.desc: 1 = No clear process, 5 = Well-defined evaluation and decision process.

questions.text: Are AI/ML tools and platforms being used?
Are AI models currently deployed?
Is the organization leveraging cloud-based AI services or building custom solutions?
How would you rate the AI/ML skills of your team?
Is there a culture of innovation around AI?
Are stakeholders aware of AI's potential and limitations?
How would you rate the AI/ML knowledge and awareness among executives?
questions.desc: 1 = Very limited, 5 = Highly knowledgeable and engaged.

questions.text: How effective are your skilling/upskilling programs for executives and business leaders?
How would you rate the overall AI literacy in your organization?
questions.desc: 1 = Very low, 5 = High across all levels.

questions.text: What business outcomes have been achieved through AI?
Are AI initiatives generating measurable ROI?
Are there measurable KPIs for AI initiatives?
Are AI systems being monitored for bias?
Are AI initiatives compliant with regulations?
Are there policies for AI fairness, transparency, and accountability?
Is the organization exploring or implementing generative AI for content creation (e.g., text, images, or code)?
questions.desc: 1 = No, 5 = Actively implemented with measurable outcomes.

questions.text: How effective is the organization at identifying generative AI use cases (e.g., chatbots, automated reports, or creative content)?
questions.desc: 1 = Not effective, 5 = Highly effective with clear use cases.

questions.text: Are there processes to evaluate the quality and ethical implications of generative AI outputs?
questions.desc: 1 = No process, 5 = Robust evaluation and ethical guidelines in place.

questions.text: Is the organization utilizing vision-based AI for tasks like image recognition, object detection, or video analysis?
questions.desc: 1 = No, 5 = Actively deployed with strong results.

questions.text: How well does the organization identify opportunities for vision-based AI applications (e.g., quality control, surveillance, or medical imaging)?
Are there sufficient data and infrastructure to support vision-based AI models?
questions.desc: 1 = No, 5 = Fully equipped with high-quality data and infrastructure.

name: Traditional Deep Learning & ML Use Cases

questions.text: Is the organization implementing traditional ML or deep learning models for tasks like predictive analytics, classification, or regression?
questions.desc: 1 = No, 5 = Actively deployed with measurable success.

questions.text: How effective is the organization at identifying traditional ML use cases (e.g., customer segmentation, fraud detection, or demand forecasting)?
questions.desc: 1 = Not effective, 5 = Highly effective with clear use cases.

questions.text: Are there adequate tools and expertise to develop and maintain traditional ML models?
questions.desc: 1 = No, 5 = Advanced tools and skilled teams in place.

questions.text: Is the organization leveraging audio-based AI for applications like speech recognition, voice assistants, or audio analysis?
questions.desc: 1 = No, 5 = Actively deployed with strong outcomes.

questions.text: How effective is the organization at identifying audio-based AI use cases (e.g., call center analytics, voice authentication, or audio event detection)?
questions.desc: 1 = Not effective, 5 = Highly effective with clear use cases.

questions.text: Are there sufficient data and infrastructure to support audio-based AI models?
questions.desc: 1 = No, 5 = Fully equipped with high-quality data and infrastructure.
